headshotImage.longCaption: Shaun Pollock player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene c Pollock b Tikolo 65 (62b 7x4 1x6 83m) SR: 104.83

dismissalComment.html: tossed up and turning in, Jayawardene comes down the track and swings hard, not a well timed shot and the ball just balloons up towards silly mid-off. Pollock calls for it and settles under it, for a second it looked like he was not in control but in the end it was a decent take. Boucher tried his best to distract Pollock so did Tikolo but...

headshotImage.longCaption: Sanath Jayasuriya player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: pitched up outside the off stump, inviting the drive, Jayasuriya drives on the up and the ball goes low to de Villiers at point who makes it look so easy

headshotImage.caption: Sourav Ganguly player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Sourav Ganguly player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled 'em, cramped for room and tries something cute, ends up looking silly, short of a length on and outside off, tries to glide it to third man, thick inside edge deviates onto middle stump, Morkel strikes and Asia being pegged back a bit

headshotImage.caption: Yuvraj Singh headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: Yuvraj Singh headshot

dismissalComment.html: and gone! good length delivery outside the off stump, Yuvraj stands tall and drives it straight to the fielder at cover - another soft dismissal, Asia XI six down

headshotImage.longCaption: Virender Sehwag player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: full and slightly loopy that time, Sehwag's eyes light up and he goes for the expansive drive over cover, front foot comes out but not in the direction of the ball and his balance is all over the place, thick inside edge deflects onto the stumps, Sehwag falls in the 40s. Chigumbura strikes

dismissalText.commentary: MS Dhoni run out (de Villiers/Odoyo) 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 13m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: short of a good length delivery and Harbhajan defends it down on the leg side, quick single called for but Harbhajan was not interested and Dhoni had to rush back. Fairly wide throw comes in, Odoyo dives across full length but fails to collect the ball cleanly but the ball ricochets on to the stumps and that's the end of Dhoni

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza 130 (110b 19x4 1x6 165m) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: Pollock is out, going for the jugular. Asian XI have won. It was slightly short in length, on the off stump line and Pollock shaped to pull it over midwicket. But it was a slower one from Mortaza  and he was early into the stroke and sent it straight to Yousuf at midwicket. It was a sensational innings from Pollock but he couldn't quite finish it off.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Mohammad Yousuf b Jayasuriya 40 (37b 5x4 1x6 36m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: Chigumbura holes out to long on. Floated in, almost at the blockhole, and Chigumbura takes out the front leg off the line and scoops it high in the air. It has to be said that it was a quite a well-timed scoop! It went all the way to long on where Yousuf was waiting for it.

headshotImage.caption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mark Boucher player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! bowled from round the stumps and this one just skids on, Boucher playing for turn gets nowhere near the line and the ball crashes into the leg stump. Six down - just four more to go

headshotImage.caption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Albie Morkel player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Gotcha!  Done in by the extra bounce. Spins in from outside off stump and kicks up. Albie shapes to cut but is surprised by the extra bounce and gets a top-edge and it thuds into Dhoni's arm and then runs on to the shoulder and pops up and Dhoni grabs it on the second attempt.

headshotImage.caption: E Chigumbura headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: E Chigumbura headshot

dismissalComment.html: Chigumbura holes out to long on. Floated in, almost at the blockhole, and Chigumbura takes out the front leg off the line and scoops it high in the air. It has to be said that it was a quite a well-timed scoop! It went all the way to long on where Yousuf was waiting for it.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Asif player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Asif player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: AB de Villiers headshot
headshotImage.longCaption: AB de Villiers headshot

dismissalComment.html: What a jaffa! Asif has cleaned him up. The perfect nip-backer. It landed on a length, just outside the off stump and de Villiers chose to leave it. To his dismay, the ball darted back in and crashed into the off stump. Asif has exacted his retribution for the previous boundary. de Villiers showed poor judgement there, playing for the outswinger

headshotImage.caption: Steve Tikolo player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Steve Tikolo player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: hitwicket!  Bizaare. Tikolo goes back to a short of length delivery and pushes it out to the off side. But alas, he drags his front leg, yes front and not back, on to the leg stump. That's strange. Usually, one goes back and ends up sliding the back leg fatally but this time he stopped himself and then the front leg went back. Gone.

image.caption: Justin Kemp profile
image.credit: United Cricket Board of South Africa

headshotImage.caption: Justin Kemp player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Justin Kemp player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Africans are tottering under the lights. It was full in length, outside the off stump, Kemp is late in getting forward, has a poke at it and the ball kept low and it gets the inside edge and goes on to the stumps. Nice move by Jayawardene to continue with Asif

dismissalText.commentary: Boeta Dippenaar b Khan 10 (13b 2x4 0x6 12m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: It's Dippenaar's time to hear the death-knell. It landed on a length, on the middle and off line and moved towards off stump. Dippenaar pushed at it, anticipating more movement away than what occured, the bat went outside the line and the off stump was pegged back. Loose defensive prod.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Mohammad Yousuf b Jayasuriya 40 (37b 5x4 1x6 36m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: Chigumbura holes out to long on. Floated in, almost at the blockhole, and Chigumbura takes out the front leg off the line and scoops it high in the air. It has to be said that it was a quite a well-timed scoop! It went all the way to long on where Yousuf was waiting for it.

dismissalText.long: c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh
dismissalText.commentary: Thomas Odoyo c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh 39 (35b 4x4 1x6 58m) SR: 111.42

dismissalComment.html: Odoyo falls. It was almost a six. Full and on the off stump and he swings it high towards deep midwicket region. Tharanga had one look at the rope, made sure he planted his foot just inside and waited for the ball to arrive. She sailed right into his palms. A thrilling cameo comes to an end. Only one wicket left. 61 from 40 balls.

dismissalComment.html: Pollock is out, going for the jugular. Asian XI have won. It was slightly short in length, on the off stump line and Pollock shaped to pull it over midwicket. But it was a slower one from Mortaza  and he was early into the stroke and sent it straight to Yousuf at midwicket. It was a sensational innings from Pollock but he couldn't quite finish it off.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza 130 (110b 19x4 1x6 165m) SR: 118.18

commentTextItems.html: Pollock is out, going for the jugular. Asian XI have won. It was slightly short in length, on the off stump line and Pollock shaped to pull it over midwicket. But it was a slower one from Mortaza  and he was early into the stroke and sent it straight to Yousuf at midwicket. It was a sensational innings from Pollock but he couldn't quite finish it off.

commentPostTextItems.html: It was a stunning knock from Pollock. The game appeared to be all over when he walked in but he had other ideas. He drove, cut and pulled his way and almost threatened to wipe the smiles off the Asian faces. He was supported brilliantly by Chigumbura and Odoyo but with their departure, it became an uphill task. Even for Pollock.
That's it from us. Good bye and Good Luck.

commentTextItems.html: Inside edges to fine leg. Full and on the leg and middle, Pollock backs away, has a wild swing and gets a edge it to fine leg boundary.
Slower one. Pollock is almost through with his shot, checks and pushes it back to the bowler
Hope floats on. Full-pitched delivery on the stumps and Pollock leans forward and  lofts it to the wide long on region.

commentPreTextItems.html: 45 from 18 balls. That's a tall order. All the hitting has to come from Pollock.

commentTextItems.html: fullish, on the middle and leg, Pollock swings it to widish long on. Pollock runs the first run hard and comes back for the second. On strike. There is still hope for the African XI
on the off stump line, on a length and Morne preserves his wicket by defending it to on side. Over to you Shaun.

commentTextItems.html: full and on the legs, flicked away to deep square leg
goes for a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss outside the off stump and Pollock reaches out and carves it behind point. Valuable runs.
Third dot ball in a row. Short in length, on the middle line, Pollock pulls but straight to midwicket.
Full in length, outside the off stump, Pollock has a swing but can't connect
ouch. Pollock backs away and Zaheer follows him with a short-pitched one. Pollock is cramped for room, tries to pull it away and is struck in the midriff
on the middle and leg, full in length, clipped away to square leg

commentTextItems.html: on the off stump line, from a length, Morne gets behind the line to defend to the off side

commentPreTextItems.html: Pollock now holds the record for the highest score by a No 7 in ODIs, beating Kaif's 111 against Zimbabwe in 2002-03

commentTextItems.html: swing and a miss. Another dot ball. It was a length-delivery that moved away from Morne
He goes down town again but Harbhajan Singh makes a neat sliding stop at long off. Only one run.
And that's why. Fullish, on the off and middle and Pollock takes out the front leg and creams it right over the bowler's head. Whoosh.

commentPreTextItems.html: Mortaza comes on to bowl. Zaheer has a chat. Then Mahela walks over. Pressure is on

commentTextItems.html: attempted yorker, ends up as a low full-toss outside the off stump, Pollock reaches out, carves it straight to deep pont. Doesn't take the single.
It was driven to long on but Pollock doesn't want to take the single. He wants the strike.

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers b Mohammad Asif 4 (2b 1x4 0x6 2m) SR: 200

dismissalComment.html: What a jaffa! Asif has cleaned him up. The perfect nip-backer. It landed on a length, just outside the off stump and de Villiers chose to leave it. To his dismay, the ball darted back in and crashed into the off stump. Asif has exacted his retribution for the previous boundary. de Villiers showed poor judgement there, playing for the outswinger

dismissalComment.html: It's Dippenaar's time to hear the death-knell. It landed on a length, on the middle and off line and moved towards off stump. Dippenaar pushed at it, anticipating more movement away than what occured, the bat went outside the line and the off stump was pegged back. Loose defensive prod.

dismissalText.commentary: Steve Tikolo hit wicket b Mohammad Asif 5 (19b 0x4 0x6 26m) SR: 26.31

dismissalComment.html: hitwicket!  Bizaare. Tikolo goes back to a short of length delivery and pushes it out to the off side. But alas, he drags his front leg, yes front and not back, on to the leg stump. That's strange. Usually, one goes back and ends up sliding the back leg fatally but this time he stopped himself and then the front leg went back. Gone.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza 130 (110b 19x4 1x6 165m) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: Pollock is out, going for the jugular. Asian XI have won. It was slightly short in length, on the off stump line and Pollock shaped to pull it over midwicket. But it was a slower one from Mortaza  and he was early into the stroke and sent it straight to Yousuf at midwicket. It was a sensational innings from Pollock but he couldn't quite finish it off.

dismissalText.commentary: Albie Morkel c †Dhoni b Jayasuriya 9 (11b 1x4 0x6 8m) SR: 81.81

dismissalComment.html: Gotcha!  Done in by the extra bounce. Spins in from outside off stump and kicks up. Albie shapes to cut but is surprised by the extra bounce and gets a top-edge and it thuds into Dhoni's arm and then runs on to the shoulder and pops up and Dhoni grabs it on the second attempt.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Mohammad Yousuf b Jayasuriya 40 (37b 5x4 1x6 36m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: Chigumbura holes out to long on. Floated in, almost at the blockhole, and Chigumbura takes out the front leg off the line and scoops it high in the air. It has to be said that it was a quite a well-timed scoop! It went all the way to long on where Yousuf was waiting for it.

dismissalText.long: c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh
dismissalText.commentary: Thomas Odoyo c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh 39 (35b 4x4 1x6 58m) SR: 111.42

dismissalComment.html: Odoyo falls. It was almost a six. Full and on the off stump and he swings it high towards deep midwicket region. Tharanga had one look at the rope, made sure he planted his foot just inside and waited for the ball to arrive. She sailed right into his palms. A thrilling cameo comes to an end. Only one wicket left. 61 from 40 balls.

dismissalComment.html: Gotcha!  Done in by the extra bounce. Spins in from outside off stump and kicks up. Albie shapes to cut but is surprised by the extra bounce and gets a top-edge and it thuds into Dhoni's arm and then runs on to the shoulder and pops up and Dhoni grabs it on the second attempt.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura c Mohammad Yousuf b Jayasuriya 40 (37b 5x4 1x6 36m) SR: 108.1

dismissalComment.html: Chigumbura holes out to long on. Floated in, almost at the blockhole, and Chigumbura takes out the front leg off the line and scoops it high in the air. It has to be said that it was a quite a well-timed scoop! It went all the way to long on where Yousuf was waiting for it.

dismissalText.long: c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh
dismissalText.commentary: Thomas Odoyo c sub (WU Tharanga) b Harbhajan Singh 39 (35b 4x4 1x6 58m) SR: 111.42

dismissalComment.html: Odoyo falls. It was almost a six. Full and on the off stump and he swings it high towards deep midwicket region. Tharanga had one look at the rope, made sure he planted his foot just inside and waited for the ball to arrive. She sailed right into his palms. A thrilling cameo comes to an end. Only one wicket left. 61 from 40 balls.

dismissalText.long: c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza
dismissalText.commentary: Shaun Pollock c Mohammad Yousuf b Mashrafe Mortaza 130 (110b 19x4 1x6 165m) SR: 118.18

dismissalComment.html: Pollock is out, going for the jugular. Asian XI have won. It was slightly short in length, on the off stump line and Pollock shaped to pull it over midwicket. But it was a slower one from Mortaza  and he was early into the stroke and sent it straight to Yousuf at midwicket. It was a sensational innings from Pollock but he couldn't quite finish it off.

milestones.description: Sehwag has become the top scorer for ASIA in ODIs with 154 runs, going past Sangakkara's 121
Shaun Pollock has become the top scorer for AFR in ODIs with 205 runs, going past Prince's 78
Shaun Pollock's 130 is the highest individual score in ODIs (for AFR), surpassing Prince's 78
Shaun Pollock has broken the record for most runs in boundaries (82) in an innings in ODIs for AFR, going past Steve Tikolo's 30
Mahela Jayawardene has scored 2 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for ASIA breaking Rahul Dravid's record
Morne Morkel has conceded the most runs in an innings (68) in ODIs for AFR, going past Monde Zondeki's record of 64
Shaun Pollock has broken the record for most catches (3) in ODIs for AFR, going past Justin Ontong's 1
Mahela Jayawardene and Mohammad Yousuf's 94-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 4th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 79 between Mahela Jayawardene and Mohammad Yousuf
Mohammad Yousuf and Yuvraj Singh's 54-run partnership is ASIA's highest for the 5th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 42 between Rahul Dravid and Sangakkara
Shaun Pollock and Chigumbura's 67-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 8th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 51 between Heath Streak and Shaun Pollock
Shaun Pollock and Thomas Odoyo's 103-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 9th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 42 between Heath Streak and Shaun Pollock
Shaun Pollock and Morne Morkel's 26-run partnership is AFR's highest for the 10th wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 24 between Prince and Dale Steyn
This is the highest match aggregate (600) involving teams Asia XI & Africa XI in ODIs
de Villiers has broken the record for most catches in an innings (3) in ODIs for AFR, going past Dippenaar's 1
Zaheer Khan has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (5) for ASIA, going past Abdul Razzaq
Dippenaar has broken the record for playing the most ODIs (4) for AFR, going past Justin Kemp
Mahela Jayawardene and Mohammad Yousuf's 94-run partnership is ASIA's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 91 between Sangakkara and Sehwag
Shaun Pollock and Thomas Odoyo's 103-run partnership is AFR's highest for any wicket in ODIs, breaking the record of 84 between Prince and Mark Boucher
